Hi John,

I have been looking at your blog and the breeze/angular part 1 & 2 videos on plural sight and had a couple of questions, there seems to be lack of knowledge integrating breeze and angular without .NET. I am running a web service on a JBoss server with a rest service written in Java, I am able to connect to the service pull data from it (all thanks to your videos and the examples from the breeze site). But when I try to saveChanges the object cannot be mapped properly and so it fails.

var newPerson = dataservice.createPerson({
  id: -1,
  name:"test me new",
  ethnicity:"",
  description:"",
  img:""
});

extendPerson(newPerson);

dataservice.saveChanges([newPerson]);

My data service saveChanges section:

function saveChanges(entities) { return manager.saveChanges(entities) .then(saveSucceeded) .fail(saveFailed); }

I know this is a long shot, it might make for a good blog post for us developer tied to different servers. I looked at the Hibernate example, and I am still not sure why the object I am creating cannot be be mapped properly (I am using a jsonResultsAdapter based on the edmunds example).

Thanks for your time, -Alessandro AUTHOR: Alex AUTHOR EMAIL: alessandro.negri@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: http://swiftuser.com SUBJECT: [John Papa] Connect IP: 209.117.122.226 Array ( [Name] => Alex [Email] => alessandro.negri@gmail.com [Website] => swiftuser.com [Comment] => Hi John,
